metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6462 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in cairo 1.16.0. There is an infinite loop in the function _arc_error_normalized in the file cairo-arc.c, related to _arc_max_angle_for_tolerance_normalized.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cairo-perf-utils - 1.14.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libcairo-gobject2 - 1.14.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libcairo-script-interpreter2 - 1.14.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
libcairo2 - 1.14.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2020-11-26, no upstream fix rodrigo-zaiden> upstream merged a commit on Aug/2021 and closed the issue on Dec/2021.

criterions.comment: cairo package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.6-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
